conclusion: To determine if displacements are the same, analyze the area under the velocity-time graph.
The x-axis represents time and the y-axis represents velocity. Curves represent velocities of Car A and Car B.
Displacement is given by the integral of velocity with respect to time.
For Car A, displacement is the area under curve A from t=0 to t=t1.
For Car B, displacement is the area under curve B from t=0 to t=t1.
Curve A starts at v2 and decreases to slightly above v1 at t=t1. Curve B starts at v1 and increases to slightly below v2 at t=t1.
Both curves intersect at some point between t=0 and t=t1.
The areas under the curves appear symmetric about the point of intersection.
The area under curve A seems to balance out with the area under curve B.
The total area under curve A is equal to the total area under curve B.
The displacements of cars A and B are the same during the time interval from t=0 to t=t1.
